cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi NNW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the Gulf of Mexico, aiming for the northern Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana‒coastal Mississippi)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near Port Fourchon–Morgan City area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Cameron, LA to the MS/AL border; Storm Surge Watch: Sabine Pass, TX to the AL/FL border (includes entire Mississippi coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: No coastal warnings yet for Mississippi–Alabama section
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely; peak gusts could approach low-end hurricane strength as Ida’s eastern eyewall brushes the Mississippi coast
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–7 ft inundation possible for Ocean Springs MS to the MS/AL border, which includes Pascagoula and its approaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches of heavy rainfall possible Sunday night–Monday with considerable flash and urban flooding risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, life-threatening rip currents, and possible short-lived tornadoes embedded in outer rainbands
